author: lepinekong
body:
<!--

For Windows PowerShell 5.1 issues, suggestions, or feature requests please use the following link instead:
- Windows PowerShell [UserVoice](https://windowsserver.uservoice.com/forums/301869-powershell)

If it is a bug report:
- make sure you are able to repro it on the latest released version. 
You can install the latest version from https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/releases
- Search the existing issues.
- Refer to the [FAQ](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/FAQ.md).
- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------

download rebol http://www.rebol.com/download-view.html
launch rebol console and type
 call/show "powershell"

From red lang console, it's even worst 
Powershell shows up without finishing initialization
http://www.red-lang.org/

Expected behavior
-----------------

Powershell loads PSReadline

```

Actual behavior
---------------
Powershell doesn't load PSReadline

```none

```

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
> $PSVersionTable

```

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
I cannot reproduce this on Windows 10. 

running

```none
call/show "pwsh"
```

from the rebol console, PowerShell Core launches and PSReadline is loaded and operating normally.

comments.author: lzybkr
comments.body: Is rebol an x86 program and you're running on x64? If so, this is a known issue with Windows PowerShell, you can fix by installing PSReadLine - just run `Install-Module PSReadLine` from the PowerShell you launched from rebol, or run `c:\windows\syswow64\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -command "Install-Module PSReadLine"`

title: Cannot load PSReadline when lauching from rebol
